reviews.review_msg: Not a difficult class if you pay attention to lectures. There are in class assignments every class so attendance is mandatory. He's easily accessible, responds to emails and pretty reachable after class. There are 3 tests and a project, mainly mc with very short answers that are fairly easy. Overall a funny and sweet guy! Would recommend

Intersession, we had 3 exams about every 2 weeks. The tests are somewhat hard especially as he doesn't clearly specify say what to expects. They are about 75% lecture and 25% reading on the tests. make sure you take notes on his opinion and what he says in class. The paper is interesting but takes time as it's a semester long paper and tracking.
I took an intersession class with him and always found his lectures engaging. His passion for the environment was also very inspiring.

Such a great guy. He really seems to love what he teaches, and he cares about his students' experiences in his class. I found him funny, and the classroom atmosphere he creates is really open and inviting (I voluntarily spoke in class and felt comfortable doing so, which is fairly rare for me)

awesome and understanding professor, super reasonable difficulty, wants to engage students, in class participation every lecture, fair amount of reading but no textbook, big term project. loved michael's class!

I have no idea some of the other reviewers from my semester are talking about. Michael is great, super accommodating, gives you clear idea on what will show up on the exam. Show up to class for bonus marks, get started on the behaviour change project early, it will help with the writing. Easy A  (even for avg B student here)

As indicated in some of the other reviews, the course is less about psychology and more about the environment and climate change.  However, in terms of difficulty, I would not say the class as a whole is challenging; as long as you finish the readings and attend lectures, you should be able to do well on the three exams

I was expecting to learn more psychology-heavy concepts in the course, but most of the theories, for example, were only present in the readings and were not discussed in-depth during the lectures. I appreciate Michael's passion for the environment but it felt like he wasn't sure what to talk about in class most of the time.

I would not recommend this class to anyone who isn't passionate about the environment. Surface-level psychology. 50% of 3h lectures were spent on discussing assignments, exams, and pointless group activities. The class is not curved, yet, the average for a relatively easy paper worth 25% that was discussed in length for months, was 68%.

What a waste of time. Every lecture he extends his explanation on minor details and doesnt elaborate on useful topics that we need to know for the exams. TA for his class sucks. Class has little to do with psychology and learning. Instead he wants you to be a climate activist. Do not take his class.

Please do yourself a favour and avoid taking any of his classes. His so-called environmental psychology course is literally just an environment course, and has almost nothing to do with psychology. He mumbles a lot when he speaks and uses a lot of filler words which was very distracting, and filled the lectures with lots of meaningless content.

Had an intersession class with him, his exams are quite straightforward since he literally gives you some or the topics that are guaranteed to be on the exam, gives extra credit in lecture, essay criteria is simple and lectures are generally interesting. You can tell hes very passionate!

Michael is such a good professor and he really wants his students to succeed. His lectures are super engaging, he has clear grading criteria and makes it clear what to expect on exams. He is probably one of the best professors I have had at sfu!

Professor Schmitt is a great environmental activist but he is not a good professor. Throughout the course he only talks about small assignments and a fair amount of our class time was wasted wanted in discussing something that was worth only a points. I am glad that I don't have to take a course with him again!
Worst class ever!

michael is an excellent prof! it's a straightforward course but you have to put in the effort to get a good grade. 366 was very informative & i learnt a lot about environmental sustainability. he genuinely wants students to learn & he's clearly very passionate about this topic. my only complaint is that he doesn't round grades, but eh. that's minor

Great course. Michael was incredibly organized and was very specific in his expectations. Simple and insightful readings and lectures every week, fair quizzes, and a fun project/ paper (weighs 40%) which he prepares you for. On top of that, we got extra credit just for participating in the first lecture. Will take him again if I can.
Michael is an amazing prof! Clearly cares about students learning and made an online class super interesting. I highly recommend this course.

Interesting class with a clear focus on social psychology and the environment. Michael is kind and caring, kept the class engaging by having a live component, and made announcements frequently to keep students up to date with the course and its happenings. Take this class!! One reading per class, engaging videos and an easy A.

You can tell hes really passionate about what hes teaching! Attendance is mandatory if you want to do well as there is online activities and participation every week. The hardes thing about this course was the quizzes that were quite ambiguous and difficult. However, the behaviour change project that makes up a big portion of your grade was fun!!

I am not too sure why there are bad reviews for Prof Schmitt - he really cares about the subject and it shows in his lecture recordings. I really enjoy he decided to give bi-weekly quizzes instead of final exams, as it gives you more opportunity to do well in the course - they aren't difficult as long as you read, watch lectures and pay attention.

I have never seen such a shameless teacher. Because of Covid19, we took an online course. The weekly reading content is not too much, but the Quiz is super hard!! Every question was like reading literature, and the answers were very ambiguous. And he is proud that only 24% of his students got the questions right.

Hands down, the best course I've taken during my undergrad. Dr. Schmitt is an inspirational, passionate professor who really wants his students to succeed. He is also extremely passionate about the environment. Besides this, the knowledge I gained from this course has helped me be more ecofriendly. Overall, I strongly recommend this course!

I never write on here but I think this is important. I highly do not recommend his class on Psych and environmental sustainability. A waste of time and money. He is not clear on what he whats you to learn, lectures are necessary but boring, brought in bad guest lecturers- did not advance my understanding at all. The paper was good and that is it.

Used to be an easy A apparently but not quite so anymore. Still, if you follow the lectures and do the readings it is pretty straight forward. Attendance is a necessity as even though he hands out slides, there is not a lot of information on them. Exams were all multiple choice.

Amazing professor. The class finally gives space for the critical issue of climate change, in which we are all struggling psychologically to comprehend. Brings in regular, everyday folks to highlight work being done to protect and connect to the environment. Safer space for Aboriginal folks interested in psych.

lecture is clear, exam is easy, and paper is fine. However, he wastes too much time on tiny issues: taking hours to talk about a 5% paper every week, and silly discussions as well (one time even for Trump election). Guest lectuers are not well qualified in the field, some of them are not even grad students but some crazy pro-environmentalists.
Do not take him for environmental sustainability. This course was soooo difficult. :( :(

Nothing against Michael -- he's a solid prof. But unless you're a major hipster, it's hard to be as interested as he is in the course material. When you have guest lecturers telling you how to make your own "zero-waste" toothpaste and how we should all reject capitalism, the class almost feels like a parody of itself.

This course has gotten me to realize that majoring PSYC was a big mistake. It's not about Michael, he's great. It's the course. This course is so hipster I thought I was in Williamsburg. Question: does making your own toothpaste make a significant contribution in protecting the environment? If your answer is no, like me, don't take this course.

Schmitt is a wonderful professor. He is knowledgeable and passionate, and he really cares about his students. He goes above and beyond when you ask him for help. Make sure the writing assignments are well written, as there are plenty of guidelines to help you... 100% would take again.

Tests are fair, all questions are based on lecture and article reading. Also considering the fact that all tests are MC questions based, it is a relatively easy credit for upper level Psyc course. Be carefully with TA's marking on the term paper term though, could be a big time killer.
Exams are hard although they are MC questions. We got peer review to edit the paper which is pretty helpful.

He's a great prof. 100% would take again. He had high interest in the subject and knows how to lecture and catch attention. Knows how to speak with pauses and not get you bored. Also doesn't overload slides or lectures with useless info. He's awesome. Tests are fair too. Good assignments. Readings interesting and no textbook. Just articles.

Michael is great. He's passionate about the environment. its great that he's teaching a class in it bc when profs are passionate about the subject, it really makes the class that much more interesting and even inspiring. The project is fun and definitely taught some things about myself. One of the most useful classes, I've taken in uni!

Very fun and interesting class! He is very passionate about it and it shows in lectures. Lectures were short and fun, easy to grasp material. Read all articles because they form the basis of the exams! Overall easy class and fun project that motivates you to do something for the environment

Very boring class. nothing really about psychology. He replies emails SO slow and very impatient. Not a helpful teacher. but the class is not difficult. Just simply boring for a psyc class. All exams are MC. Learned nothing useful from this course. regrets!

Dr. Schmitt is passionate about environmental & social psychology, & he didn't only make a difference in my academic life, but in my life in general. He adds components of experiential education in his teachings, which make it easier for students to relate to concepts. He is engaging, funny, & draws upon material which are meaningful & interesting.

One of the easiest classes I've taken so far! He's very helped, he put my files into pdf form when I was having trouble uploading files. 2 mts and 1 term paper and 3 mini papers. All super easy, there should be no reason for not getting a good grade. I got an A- in the course. Make sure to do the readings for the mts.

Class is great but exams are HARD. Previous semesters were stricly SA exams, & though he's now added MC & T/F, I FAILED both the midterm & final. But.. I aced all 3 papers that totaled 50% of my mark & ended up with an A. How does that even work?! Do your very best on your papers & you won't have much pressure for the exams!!

He is SOO BORING!! Do not go to his lectures, they are a waste of time and not necessary to do well in this class! He reads directly off the slides and talks very very very slowly. Takes about half an hour to get through one slide. Great for gpa boosting though!

Great class & prof. Not a fan of non "textbook" type reading material, it's more of an educational book than one filled with definitions etc., so found it hard to study just lecture notes. But he's very fair & the information is interesting. Definitely recommend this prof

I thought this course was extremely interesting. Lectures are not boring at all and encourage you to see how these issues are manifest in everyday life. If you do the work, you'll almost certainly get a high mark. Not scaled either. I would give this prof and course an A+

PLEASE! HOW BORING CAN YOU GET?! AWFUL! The good part about it is that lectures are recorded and you don't have to go to class...but then again, BOORRRIIINGGGG!Take something that you are interested in, don't waste money on classes like this. Third year should be all about what you want to do in the future! THIS IS SOOO BORING!

Michael Schmitt! You gotta take his class for sure! Not only is his class a GPA booster, his lecture is also very inspiring. He is my favourite professor out of all other PSYC profs I had at SFU. and it's my last semester here. so, what are you still waiting for? Go register for his class!!!!

AWSOME PROF!! best psyc prof ever. Even though lecture was a bit boring, but the material was really interesting. The prof is also very helpful and encourages questions. i would definitely take this course, and its a GPA booster!

Definitely take this class!! GPA booster!! Class is not scaled so everyone can get an A+!! Material is interesting. Lecture is boring. Papers + Exams were straightforward. Almost half the class got perfect on the papers.

He's really intelligent and super nice/kind but the way he lectures is quite dry. It was intersession so we saw him 6 hours a week. The course was ridiculously easy though. Simply put the papers were marked so easy I think the average was 95% and the exams were were pretty good too. Too bad he's going on a break and isn't teaching until Fall 2010

Michael is a very nice person and very helpful to students...but lectures are not so interesting. The material is very interesting, but somehow it seems to come out of his mouth SO SLOWLY. But again, he`s a nice guy, not to mention the class is super easy. The first paper avg mark was 93%.

I am in my final and 4th year at SFU and michael schmitt has been the BEST professor I have ever had! He's such an intelligent individual, he really makes you feel engaged in his lectures and everything he teaches is so inspiring and really challenges you as a person. If I could take this class all over again I'd do it in a heartbeat!

His lectures are kind of boring; I think the material could be lectured in a way more interesting way. The readings are necessary, but then you must attend lecture. Exams are mostly on lectures. Exams are fair, and fairly marked. Assignments are fairly easy and fairly marked. Class average is usually high though- don't know if it's curved.
he is really good

it was a seminar class that ran like a lecture.  Half way through class all I want to do is bang my head on the table. Class was just reviewing the data from the article we had to read.Student discussion was non-existent.  However, I cant hate him because he is smart and helpful,just dont make me sit through another class!

The class is SUPER easy, but he's a tool. Take the class because it's a GPA booster - he gives you 'exam prep' and they are the same questions that will be on the exams. Even the assignment is based soley on personal work - no referencing needed. He is an ok prof, just seems a little immature.
So boring.  He's a great guy and he definitely wants his students to do well, but man oh man, his lecturing style is dry.  Might improve in a few years.
he is an awesome prof. he gives study guides before the midterm and the final which is pretty much a copy of the actual test.lol. if u just do the study guide u'll do okay.
Very boring lectures but you have to listen to them as he tests mostly on lecture material. Exams are really easy and the papers were graded easily as well. I think the average on both was around 80.

He may be good in a few years when he realizes that good professors lecture from their own material and not  straight out of the text. He also posts his lectures online and just reads them aloud in class, therefore the attendance in his lectures is getting smaller and smaller. Very boring class, but he may get better.
very boring. never lectures beyond  his notes which he posts online. no need to go to class
